intro: Verbascum adenosepalum, commonly known as the narrowleaf mullein, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, velvety leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in dry, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been historically used in traditional herbal remedies.
